body_html:
It’s perfect! Thanks a bunch!
…
On Jan 20, 2017, at 10:53 AM, Asim Shankar ***@***.***> wrote: We're going through some API churn as we try to stabilize things for the 1.0 release (and can provide stability for all 1.x release as per our versioning policy <https://www.tensorflow.org/resources/versions>). See RELEASE.md <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/RELEASE.md> for changes. In this particular case: tf.inv has been renamed to be tf.reciprocal (component-wise reciprocal) to avoid confusion with np.inv which is matrix inversion. Apologies for the churn, once we hit 1.0, things should be much more stable. Hope that help! — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#6981 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AB2BMlYAf8FW9ji2ddwKnkejtgHvHWESks5rUQKQgaJpZM4Lpnly>.
body_text:
It’s perfect! Thanks a bunch!
…
 On Jan 20, 2017, at 10:53 AM, Asim Shankar ***@***.***> wrote:

 We're going through some API churn as we try to stabilize things for the 1.0 release (and can provide stability for all 1.x release as per our versioning policy <https://www.tensorflow.org/resources/versions>). See RELEASE.md <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/RELEASE.md> for changes.

 In this particular case:
 tf.inv has been renamed to be tf.reciprocal (component-wise reciprocal) to avoid confusion with np.inv which is matrix inversion.

 Apologies for the churn, once we hit 1.0, things should be much more stable.

 Hope that help!

 —
 You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#6981 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AB2BMlYAf8FW9ji2ddwKnkejtgHvHWESks5rUQKQgaJpZM4Lpnly>.
body:
It’s perfect! Thanks a bunch!


> On Jan 20, 2017, at 10:53 AM, Asim Shankar <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> We're going through some API churn as we try to stabilize things for the 1.0 release (and can provide stability for all 1.x release as per our versioning policy <https://www.tensorflow.org/resources/versions>). See RELEASE.md <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/RELEASE.md> for changes.
> 
> In this particular case:
> tf.inv has been renamed to be tf.reciprocal (component-wise reciprocal) to avoid confusion with np.inv which is matrix inversion.
> 
> Apologies for the churn, once we hit 1.0, things should be much more stable.
> 
> Hope that help!
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
